title: Bitcoin Genesis Block
summary: Satoshi Nakamoto mines the first Bitcoin block, embedding 'The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks' in the coinbase.

title: Bitcoin Pizza Day
summary: Laszlo Hanyecz pays 10,000 BTC for two Papa John's pizzas, marking the first real-world Bitcoin transaction.

title: Silk Road Launches
summary: Ross Ulbricht launches Silk Road, the first major darknet marketplace using Bitcoin for anonymous payments.

title: Mt. Gox First Hack
summary: Mt. Gox, the largest Bitcoin exchange at the time, suffers a security breach that leads to a flash crash from $17.50 to $0.01.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange briefly suspended trading and eventually restored prices.

title: First Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 50 BTC to 25 BTC at block 210,000, the first of its kind.

title: Mt. Gox Collapse
summary: Mt. Gox halts all withdrawals and files for bankruptcy after revealing 850,000 BTC (~$450M at the time) were stolen over several years.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange filed for bankruptcy; creditors still awaiting payouts a decade later.

title: Ethereum Mainnet Launch
summary: Ethereum goes live with the Frontier release, introducing smart contracts and a Turing-complete blockchain.

title: The DAO Hack
summary: An attacker exploits a reentrancy bug in The DAO smart contract, draining 3.6M ETH (~$60M), leading to the controversial Ethereum hard fork.

crimeline.aftermath: Ethereum community split; hard fork created ETH and ETC chains.

title: Bitfinex Hack
summary: Hackers steal 119,756 BTC (~$72M) from Bitfinex exchange in the second largest Bitcoin theft at the time.

crimeline.aftermath: Bitfinex issued BFX tokens to affected users; DOJ later recovered some funds in 2022.

title: Second Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 25 BTC to 12.5 BTC at block 420,000.

title: ICO Boom Begins
summary: Initial Coin Offerings explode in popularity, raising billions for blockchain projects with minimal regulation.

title: Bitcoin Reaches $20,000
summary: Bitcoin hits its first major all-time high of nearly $20,000, capturing mainstream attention and sparking institutional interest.

title: China Bans ICOs
summary: China's central bank declares all ICO fundraising illegal, triggering a market crash and setting a precedent for regulatory crackdowns.

title: Cryptopia Exchange Hack
summary: New Zealand-based Cryptopia exchange is hacked, losing approximately $16M in various cryptocurrencies.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange went into liquidation; partial funds recovered for creditors.

title: PlusToken Ponzi Collapse
summary: PlusToken Ponzi scheme collapses after defrauding approximately $2B+ from Asian investors through fake cryptocurrency investment platform.

crimeline.aftermath: Chinese authorities arrested key operators; funds partially traced and seized.

title: DeFi Summer Begins
summary: Compound launches COMP token governance mining, igniting 'DeFi Summer' and explosive growth in decentralized finance protocols.

title: Uniswap V2 Launches
summary: Uniswap V2 launches with ERC20-ERC20 pools, flash swaps, and price oracles, becoming the leading decentralized exchange.

title: Third Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 12.5 BTC to 6.25 BTC at block 630,000.

title: KuCoin Exchange Hack
summary: KuCoin suffers a major security breach with hackers stealing over $280M in various cryptocurrencies.

crimeline.aftermath: Most funds recovered through project freezes and law enforcement; exchange compensated users.

title: Poly Network Hack
summary: A hacker exploits Poly Network cross-chain protocol, stealing over $600M in the largest DeFi hack at the time. The hacker later returned most funds.

crimeline.aftermath: Hacker returned funds after negotiations; was offered security role.

title: Bitcoin Hits $69,000 ATH
summary: Bitcoin reaches all-time high of $69,044, marking the peak of the 2021 bull run before a prolonged bear market.

title: Cream Finance Flash Loan Attack
summary: Cream Finance suffers its third hack of 2021, losing $130M in a sophisticated flash loan oracle manipulation attack.

crimeline.aftermath: Third major exploit for Cream; protocol credibility severely damaged.

title: Wormhole Bridge Hack
summary: Wormhole cross-chain bridge is exploited for 120,000 wETH (~$320M) due to a signature verification vulnerability.

crimeline.aftermath: Jump Crypto replaced the stolen funds to make users whole.

title: Ronin Bridge Hack
summary: North Korean hackers (Lazarus Group) exploit the Ronin bridge used by Axie Infinity, stealing $625M in the largest DeFi hack ever.

crimeline.aftermath: FBI attributed attack to Lazarus Group; Sky Mavis raised funds to reimburse users.

title: Terra/LUNA Collapse
summary: The UST algorithmic stablecoin loses its peg, triggering a death spiral that wipes out $40B+ in value and collapses the Terra ecosystem.

crimeline.aftermath: Do Kwon charged with fraud; triggered cascading failures across crypto lending platforms.

title: Celsius Network Freezes Withdrawals
summary: Crypto lender Celsius halts all withdrawals citing 'extreme market conditions,' later filing for bankruptcy with $4.7B hole.

crimeline.aftermath: Filed for bankruptcy; CEO Alex Mashinsky later arrested for fraud.

title: Three Arrows Capital Defaults
summary: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital defaults on over $3.5B in loans after LUNA collapse, triggering contagion across the industry.

crimeline.aftermath: Founders fled Singapore; creditors pursuing billions in claims.

title: Voyager Digital Bankruptcy
summary: Crypto broker Voyager files for bankruptcy after Three Arrows Capital default, leaving customers unable to access $1.3B in assets.

crimeline.aftermath: Bankruptcy proceedings; FTX initially bid to acquire before its own collapse.

title: Nomad Bridge Hack
summary: Nomad cross-chain bridge is drained of $190M in a chaotic 'free-for-all' attack where hundreds of users exploited a vulnerability.

crimeline.aftermath: First 'crowd-sourced' hack; some whitehats returned funds.

title: Ethereum Merge
summary: Ethereum successfully transitions from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake, reducing energy consumption by ~99.95%.

title: FTX Exchange Collapse
summary: FTX, the third-largest crypto exchange, files for bankruptcy after revelations of misusing $8B+ in customer funds through Alameda Research.

crimeline.aftermath: SBF arrested and convicted of fraud; sentenced to 25 years in prison.

title: Genesis Trading Bankruptcy
summary: Genesis Global Capital files for bankruptcy owing $3.5B to creditors after being hit by Three Arrows Capital and FTX collapses.

crimeline.aftermath: DCG parent company faced SEC charges; settlement reached with NY AG.

title: Euler Finance Flash Loan Attack
summary: Euler Finance lending protocol is exploited for $197M in a flash loan attack targeting the donation and liquidation mechanics.

crimeline.aftermath: Attacker negotiated return of funds after on-chain messages and negotiations.

title: SEC vs Ripple Partial Victory
summary: Judge rules XRP is not a security when sold on exchanges, marking a significant legal precedent for the crypto industry.

title: Mixin Network Hack
summary: Mixin Network cloud service provider is hacked, resulting in approximately $200M in losses from the decentralized network.

crimeline.aftermath: Network suspended deposits/withdrawals; offered 10% bug bounty to attacker.

title: Bitcoin Spot ETF Approved
summary: SEC approves 11 spot Bitcoin ETFs including BlackRock and Fidelity, marking a historic milestone for institutional crypto adoption.

title: Fourth Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC at block 840,000, continuing the predictable monetary policy.

title: Bitcoin Breaks $100,000
summary: Bitcoin surpasses $100,000 for the first time, driven by ETF inflows and post-halving dynamics.

title: Radiant Capital Multi-Chain Hack
summary: Radiant Capital suffers a $50M exploit across Arbitrum and BNB Chain through compromised multi-sig signers.

crimeline.aftermath: Protocol paused lending markets; investigation ongoing.

title: Beanstalk Governance Attack
summary: Attacker uses flash loan to gain governance power in Beanstalk protocol, draining $182M in a sophisticated governance attack.

crimeline.aftermath: Protocol attempted to rebuild through community fundraise.

title: SEC Twitter Hacked for Fake Bitcoin ETF Approval
summary: The SEC's official X account was compromised via SIM swap attack, posting a fake Bitcoin ETF approval that caused BTC to spike $1,000 then crash $2,000. Eric Council Jr. was later arrested for the hack.

crimeline.aftermath: FBI arrested Eric Council Jr. in October 2024. Real ETF approval came the next day.

title: $SLERF Developer Accidentally Burns $10M
summary: Slerf developer accidentally burned all $10M of presale investor funds while trying to distribute tokens. Instead of killing the project, the community rallied and pushed market cap to $660M, turning a disaster into a bizarre success story.

crimeline.aftermath: Community rallied, token reached $660M market cap. Became legendary meme moment.

title: 12-Year-Old Rug Pulls $QUANT for $20K
summary: A 12-year-old kid rug pulled $QUANT token for $20,000 during a live stream. Crypto Twitter responded by pumping the market cap to $85M to 'teach the kid a lesson' about the power of community.

root_cause: Exit scam by minor during livestream
crimeline.aftermath: Crypto Twitter pumped token to $85M market cap in retaliation. Became viral story.

title: $HAWK Token Crashes After Launch
summary: Viral 'Hawk Tuah Girl' launched $HAWK token which immediately crashed. She held a Space to explain, @chooserich joined to confront her, she said she was 'tired' and ended the call, then went silent for two weeks while investors lost millions.

crimeline.aftermath: Creator disappeared for 2 weeks. Became cautionary tale about celebrity tokens.

title: Sahil Orchestrates Mass Celebrity Token Scam
summary: Sahil Arora convinced celebrities including Floyd Mayweather, Caitlyn Jenner, and Sexxy Redd to launch and promote tokens, then orchestrated coordinated rug pulls across all projects.

crimeline.aftermath: Exposed celebrity token scam operations. Multiple tokens crashed.

title: Scooter Exposes Rizzmas as Complete Scam
summary: Crypto influencer Scooter (@imperooterxbt) revealed Rizzmas was a complete scam, causing its market cap to plummet from $100M to $20M and triggering backlash from TikTok investors who lost money.

root_cause: Coordinated scam targeting social media users
crimeline.aftermath: Market cap crashed from $100M to $20M after exposure. Whistleblower faced harassment.

title: ApeFest Hong Kong UV Light Incident
summary: Guests at BAYC's ApeFest Hong Kong reported severe eye pain and vision problems from UV lights at the event. Less than 1% affected but became a major PR crisis for Yuga Labs.

root_cause: Improper UV lighting at event venue
crimeline.aftermath: BAYC issued statement, recommended medical attention for affected guests. PR damage to brand.

title: Church of the Chicken Pastor Scams Followers
summary: Pastor Kelby of the viral 'Church of the Chicken' used his religious influence to promote low-cap memecoins for payment, leading to his expulsion from the church he founded.

root_cause: Influencer using religious authority for financial gain
crimeline.aftermath: Pastor expelled from church, church plans collapsed.

title: CZ Posts 'gm' Upon Prison Release
summary: Binance founder Changpeng 'CZ' Zhao returned to X the same day he was released from his 4-month prison sentence, posting a casual 'gm' that became one of crypto Twitter's most celebrated comebacks.

title: Bybit Exchange Suffers Record $1.5B Ethereum Heist
summary: Dubai-based centralized exchange Bybit was hacked during a routine transfer between cold and warm wallets, with attackers exploiting vulnerabilities in a third-party multi-sig wallet provider to drain around 401,000 ETH (~$1.4–$1.5B), the largest crypto theft on record.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Compromised developer infrastructure at Safe{Wallet} (multi-sig provider)
crimeline.aftermath: Bybit pledged full client asset backing, launched a recovery bounty program, and worked with blockchain forensics to track stolen funds; industry debate over exchange custody security intensified.

title: Coinbase Customer Data Breach via Rogue Support Agents
summary: Coinbase disclosed a major security breach in which cybercriminals bribed overseas customer support agents to steal personal and account information (names, IDs, contact details) of a subset of users; no account passwords, 2FA, private keys, or funds were accessed.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Bribery and recruitment of Coinbase support personnel
Insufficient internal access controls over sensitive user data
crimeline.aftermath: Coinbase refused the $20M ransom demand, is cooperating with law enforcement, plans criminal charges, expects up to $400M in remediation/compensation costs and offered $20M reward for arrest info.

title: Cetus Protocol Smart Contract Exploit Drains $223M
summary: On Sui’s largest decentralized exchange, Cetus Protocol suffered a major exploit where attackers introduced spoof tokens to manipulate price oracles within the AMM, draining liquidity pools for about $223M but ~$162M was later frozen and partially recovered.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Price manipulation via spoof token insertion
Smart contract vulnerability in AMM pricing feeds
crimeline.aftermath: Cetus paused operations, froze $162M of compromised funds, and resumed protocol operations ~17 days after the attack; highlighted risks of oracle/math logic in automated market makers.

title: Nobitex Centralized Exchange Hack Drains ~$90M
summary: Iran’s largest exchange Nobitex was hit by an exploit that drained around $90M worth of primarily USDT on the Tron network; pro-Israeli hacker group Gonjeshke Darande (Predatory Sparrow) claimed responsibility alleging IRGC ties, though many retail users were likely collateral victims.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

crimeline.aftermath: Nobitex temporarily suspended services, community debate over political risks and exchange security emerged; uncertain victim recovery path.

title: Upbit Solana Hot Wallet Hack (~$36M)
summary: South Korean exchange Upbit reported a hot wallet compromise where attackers stole around $36M in Solana-based assets including meme coins; authorities and analysts quickly attributed the attack to North Korean Lazarus actors due to the attack’s speed and pattern.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

crimeline.victims_estimated: Upbit customers exposed to Solana assets
root_cause: Rapid exploit execution characteristic of state-linked hacking groups
crimeline.aftermath: Upbit moved remaining funds to cold storage and worked with authorities; highlighted hot wallet risks during high-speed exploits.

title: $TRUMP Launch Sparks Frenzy, Then Massive Drawdown
summary: Donald Trump promoted the ‘Official Trump Meme’ token ($TRUMP), triggering a rapid speculative surge in January. After peaking shortly after launch, $TRUMP spent the rest of 2025 in a sustained unwind, becoming a flagship example of ‘political memecoin’ volatility and retail drawdowns.

title: $MELANIA Token Launch Triggers Fast Boom-Bust
summary: Melania Trump promoted the $MELANIA token, which ripped upward immediately after launch before entering a steep, prolonged drawdown—reinforcing the ‘celebrity/political memecoin’ pattern of reflexive hype followed by rapid value erosion.

title: $LIBRA ‘Cryptogate’ Rug-Pull Scandal in Argentina
summary: Argentina’s President Javier Milei promoted the $LIBRA token, which rapidly pumped and then collapsed amid allegations of insiders extracting liquidity and dumping supply. Blockchain researchers and subsequent reporting focused on large wallet withdrawals and market-maker style liquidity drains consistent with a rug/pump-and-dump pattern.

crimeline.aftermath: Political scandal (‘Cryptogate’) and broad public scrutiny of memecoin launches tied to public figures.

title: Bybit Suffers ~$1.5B Exchange Hack
summary: Bybit disclosed a major ETH wallet compromise that became the largest widely reported crypto heist to date in 2025. U.S. authorities later attributed the theft to North Korean actors (‘TraderTraitor’) and warned the stolen assets were being laundered across many addresses.

crimeline.aftermath: Bybit reassured users of solvency and initiated investigation; authorities issued attribution and laundering warnings.

title: Mantra (OM) Token Dumps ~90% in Hours
summary: OM experienced a rapid, severe collapse—widely described as a ‘token dump’—with reporting and analysis pointing to structural fragility: concentrated holdings, thin liquidity, and liquidation cascades that turned selling pressure into a fast wipeout.

title: Circle (CRCL) Begins Trading After Upsized IPO
summary: Circle, issuer of USDC, priced an upsized IPO and began trading on the NYSE under ticker CRCL, marking a major TradFi milestone for stablecoin infrastructure and regulated public-market access.

title: First U.S.-Listed Solana + Staking ETF Launches (SSK)
summary: REX Shares and Osprey Funds launched SSK, described as the first U.S.-listed ETF offering Solana price exposure alongside staking rewards, signaling accelerating ETF experimentation beyond BTC/ETH and into yield-bearing structures.

title: GENIUS Act Signed Into Law
summary: President Trump signed the GENIUS Act into law, positioning it as a landmark U.S. digital-assets policy move and a catalyst for broader institutional adoption narratives during 2025.

title: Mass npm JavaScript Supply-Chain Attack Hits Widely Used Packages
summary: A large-scale supply-chain compromise targeted multiple high-download npm packages, highlighting how maintainer credential theft and malicious version publishing can weaponize developer tooling. Security reporting warned some malicious behaviors included covert crypto-asset diversion techniques via hijacked web APIs and traffic manipulation.

crimeline.aftermath: Security teams audited dependencies, rotated credentials, and pinned/rolled back compromised versions across ecosystems.

title: CZ-Linked $ASTER / Aster DEX ‘Debacle’ After DefiLlama Delisting
summary: Aster’s reported perpetuals volume came under heavy scrutiny when DefiLlama moved to delist Aster’s perp volume data over integrity concerns, sparking a broader debate about wash trading, unverifiable volume metrics, and incentive-driven ‘fake liquidity’ across perps venues. The controversy coincided with sharp volatility in the associated token narrative.

title: October 10 ‘Nuke’: Record Liquidation Cascade Slams Crypto
summary: A historic leverage unwind on October 10 triggered a massive cross-venue liquidation cascade, widely cited as the largest single liquidation event in crypto history. The event became a case study in how liquidity gaps and venue design amplify forced selling under stress.

title: Cobie’s UpOnly Returns After Coinbase Buys the Control NFT
summary: Cobie had previously tied the return of his UpOnly podcast to an NFT mechanism; in October, Coinbase purchased the UpOnly control NFT for $25M, effectively triggering the podcast’s return and cementing ‘podcast rights as an onchain asset’ as a defining cultural moment.

title: Cobie Sells Echo to Coinbase for ~$375M
summary: Coinbase agreed to acquire Echo, Cobie’s crypto fundraising/investment platform, in a deal reported at roughly $375M (cash and stock). The move signaled Coinbase’s push deeper into capital formation tooling (token sales and fundraising rails) amid a more permissive U.S. crypto environment.

title: James Wynn Liquidation Becomes Leverage Cautionary Tale
summary: Trader James Wynn’s highly leveraged Hyperliquid positions were publicly tracked as they were liquidated, turning his account into a viral case study in how extreme leverage and reflexive crowd attention can accelerate forced closes and wipeouts.

title: First Chainlink Spot ETF Launches (Grayscale GLNK)
summary: Grayscale’s Chainlink product converted/listed as GLNK on NYSE Arca, widely described as the first U.S. spot Chainlink ETF/ETP, expanding the ‘altcoin ETF’ wave and formalizing LINK exposure in a regulated wrapper.

links.label: Grayscale GLNK product page (ETP listing date)

title: Trust Wallet Chrome Extension Supply-Chain Compromise (v2.68)
summary: Trust Wallet reported that a malicious/unapproved Chrome extension release (v2.68) was published outside its standard process, enabling attackers to access sensitive wallet data and execute unauthorized transactions for users who ran the compromised version during the exposure window.

crimeline.aftermath: Extension rollout halted; incident response, user remediation steps, and reimbursement process initiated for verified losses.

title: Beeple’s 'Everydays' NFT Sells for $69.3M at Christie’s
summary: Beeple’s 'Everydays: The First 5000 Days' becomes a watershed NFT moment when Christie’s sells it for $69,346,250—catapulting NFTs into mainstream finance, art, and culture.

title: Coinbase Goes Public in Landmark Direct Listing
summary: Coinbase lists publicly via a direct listing, marking a major 'crypto goes mainstream' milestone and validating exchange-driven market infrastructure in public equities.

title: Dogecoin Mania Peaks Around Elon Musk’s SNL Appearance
summary: Dogecoin’s 2021 meme-cycle reaches cultural saturation as speculation builds into Elon Musk’s Saturday Night Live appearance—followed by the familiar post-hype drawdown that defined memecoin volatility for a generation of retail traders.

title: Tesla Suspends Bitcoin Payments Over Energy Concerns
summary: Elon Musk posts that Tesla is suspending vehicle purchases using Bitcoin, citing the energy mix behind mining—triggering a sharp sentiment shift and amplifying the 'ESG vs crypto' narrative across markets.

title: China Escalates Crackdown on Bitcoin Mining and Trading
summary: China’s policy posture hardens as authorities move to clamp down on Bitcoin mining and trading, forcing hashpower migration and setting the tone for a more adversarial regulatory environment in key jurisdictions.

title: Ethereum Activates London Upgrade (EIP-1559 Fee Burn)
summary: Ethereum’s London hard fork ships EIP-1559, introducing base-fee burning and changing ETH’s monetary dynamics—one of the most consequential protocol-level shifts in the asset’s history.

title: El Salvador Adopts Bitcoin as Legal Tender
summary: El Salvador becomes the first nation-state to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender, turning crypto into a geopolitical headline and sparking global debate on monetary sovereignty, remittances, and macro risk.

title: Snoop Dogg Claims NFT Whale Persona '@CozomoMedici'
summary: NFT Twitter gets a pure 2021 plot twist when Snoop Dogg tweets 'I am @CozomoMedici,' linking celebrity identity, provenance signaling, and high-end NFT collecting into a single viral moment.

title: Fake Walmart–Litecoin Press Release Whipsaws LTC Price
summary: A fraudulent press release claiming Walmart would accept Litecoin briefly spikes LTC before denials—highlighting how thin liquidity + headline reflexes can turn misinformation into instant market structure chaos.

title: Solana Hits ~$259 as 2021 Hype Cycle Reaches Peak
summary: Solana’s 2021 run culminates in a ~$259 price print as NFTs, DeFi, and high-throughput narratives converge—cementing SOL as a defining L1 of the bull market (and a future benchmark for ETF-era debates).

title: Squid Game Token Collapses in Classic Rug Pull
summary: The 'SQUID' token—marketed off Netflix’s Squid Game—rockets, traps buyers with sell restrictions, then collapses as insiders drain liquidity, becoming a textbook 'too viral to be true' rug pull.

crimeline.aftermath: Token price cratered to near-zero; project channels vanished; became a widely-cited cautionary tale during the memecoin/NFT mania phase.

title: ConstitutionDAO Loses Sotheby’s Bid After Raising Millions in ETH
summary: ConstitutionDAO rallies crypto Twitter to buy a rare U.S. Constitution copy at Sotheby’s, raises tens of millions in ETH, then loses the auction—turning coordination, gas fees, and refunds into a mass-participation stress test for on-chain fundraising.

title: UK ASA Investigates Floki Inu 'Missed Doge? Get Floki' Ads
summary: Floki Inu’s London transport ad blitz triggers a formal inquiry by the UK’s Advertising Standards Authority, spotlighting the memecoin marketing meta—and the regulatory whiplash of advertising unregulated financial products to commuters.

title: Bukele Unveils ‘Bitcoin City’ Plan in El Salvador
summary: Fresh off making BTC legal tender, Bukele announces a proposed ‘Bitcoin City’ and bitcoin-backed bond concept—blending sovereign branding, tax incentives, and volcano-energy spectacle into the archetype of the 2021 nation-state crypto narrative.

title: India PM Modi’s Twitter Briefly Compromised for Bitcoin Scam Post
summary: Hackers briefly seize control of India’s prime minister’s Twitter account to post a fake Bitcoin adoption/giveaway message—an absurd, high-profile reminder that social accounts remain systemic attack surfaces for market manipulation and scams.

crimeline.aftermath: Tweet was removed and account restored; incident amplified concerns about high-reach account security and headline-driven price reflexes.
